messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] nintendo question
messages.msgSnippet: Minnesota. They even had Wii s this weekend...but they are all gone. hOPE YOU CAN FIND THEM SOON BECAUSE WHEN THEY GET TO THE STORE THEY ARE OUT IN MINUTES...
messages.messageBody:
Minnesota. They even had Wii's this weekend...but they are all gone. hOPE YOU CAN FIND THEM SOON BECAUSE WHEN THEY GET TO THE STORE THEY ARE OUT IN MINUTES...
Alex


----- Original Message -----
From: Sylvia Toyama
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, January 22, 2007 8:28 PM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] nintendo question


I see they started to show up at the stores again so I would wait just a couple more weeks so not to pay more thatn $129 for the lite.
Alex

*****

Where do you live that stores have Nintendos? I called every Target, Toys R Us, Circuit City, Best Buy and Game Stop in Albuquerque (I even called the evil Wal-mart) -- no one has even one. They don't really expect any til next month, but can't know for sure since Nintendo gives no advance notice of what/when they're shipping to retailers.

I was asking because I'd gone online and found some regular DS's at amazon.com for reasonable prices --- all the DS Lites at ebay and amazon are $200 or more.

Sylvia

Gary (dh)
Will (almost 22!) Andy (10-1/2) and Dan (almost 6)

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] nintendo question
messages.msgSnippet: Hey all, Liam actually discovered on the lite a couple of nights ago that you can adjust the brightness of the screen; so make it duller for use in the
messages.messageBody:
Hey all,

Liam actually discovered on the lite a couple of nights ago that you can adjust the brightness of the screen; so make it duller for use in the sunlight and brighter for night time use. I can't remember how he did it, I think he pressed one of the (A, B, X, Y) buttons whilst onthe opening screen (before you log in to the game).

Kindest Wishes,
Anita
-xxx-


----- Original Message -----
From: SquishyMommyof2@...
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, January 23, 2007 4:38 AM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] nintendo question




Wow really? I had the total opposite experience. I couldn't see the lite
screen at all. Especially in the sun. Maybe it's just my bad eyesight and
resfusal to wear glasses <g>

In a message dated 1/22/2007 11:55:17 A.M. Central Standard Time,
witchymama2@... writes:

The DS Lite has a brighter backlit screen. In comparing them side by side,
the difference really is huge. The game is just so much easier to see with
the Lite.

Other than that, I haven't found any difference except the slight change in
shape that isn't really that noticable.

If you're buying one, I'd definatly go for the Lite.

-Ana

~Alyssa in IL
_http://squishymommy.blogspot.com_ (http://squishymommy.blogspot.com/)

" Work like you don't need the money, love like you've never been hurt, and
dance like you do when nobody's watching."

"All that is necessary for the triumph of evil is that good people do
nothing."

" Knowledge is power but how you use that power defines wether you are good
or evil."

messages.msgSnippet: The screen may look smaller but if you measure they are the same. Alex ... From: SquishyMommyof2@aol.com To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com Sent: Monday,
messages.messageBody:
The screen may look smaller but if you measure they are the same.
Alex


----- Original Message -----
From: SquishyMommyof2@...
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, January 22, 2007 12:26 PM
Subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] nintendo question




I got my DS during the christmas season, they had NO lite's so i had to get
there reg one instead( i wanted the lite since it was the new one). Boy am i
glad i got the normal one. Our good friend has the lite, and yes it may be
smaller and lighter but the screen is smaller as well and you cant see it at
all in the sunlight. I would say get the normal DS.

In a message dated 1/22/2007 11:19:16 A.M. Central Standard Time,
sylgt04@... writes:

I'm trying to find nintendo ds for the boys -- none in stock at actual
stores, tho I have found some at amazon.com.

Some questions, tho, since I'm likely to be buying remotely -- what's the
difference between a the Nintendo DS and the Nintendo DS Lite? They look
somewhat different, but I have no idea how they differ functionally.

Any nintendo experts here?

~Alyssa in IL
_http://squishymommy.blogspot.com_ (http://squishymommy.blogspot.com/)

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] nintendo question
messages.msgSnippet: The lite is smaller and lighter  and the do a little better in more light. That is it. They are the same in any other way. OH the little stencil pen is thicker
messages.messageBody:
The lite is smaller and lighter and the do a little better in more light. That is it. They are the same in any other way. OH the little stencil pen is thicker in the lite also.\\
We have both and like both.
I see they started to show up at the stores again so I would wait just a couple more weeks so not to pay more thatn $129 for the lite.
Alex
